page.title: 01BROMSGROVE GAZETTEER
page.content: Bromsgrove is one of the many pleasant towns of Worcestershire. The {High St.}has recently been pedestrian- ised. The cattle market was replaced by a Fine Fare supermarket.{St. {John's,}Bromsgrove's parish church, has parts dating from the 12th century. Bromsgrove has a large park, {Sanders Park,}with a brook running through it. The most famous school in the area is{Bromsgrove School.} Once out of the town you come to lots of countryside. The{M5 motorway cuts through this. Around Dodford there are lots of farms, mainly arable, or grazing for sheep and dairy cows. There are always things happening in Bromsgrove that you can either take part in, like the Bromsgrove Fun Run, or watch, like the{Court Leet Pro- {cession}and the {Carnival.
